gists.title: 33 Times Hash
gists.paragraph: This is Daniel J. Bernstein's popular 'times 33' hash function

gists.title: Calc Merkle Tree Size
gists.paragraph: Utility for calculating merkle tree size config when setting up a Solana compressed NFT project.

gists.title: Irys in SvelteKit
gists.paragraph: Upload files on-chain using Irys and Sveltekit.

gists.title: OTP
gists.paragraph: Utility for implementing and verifying OTPs.

gists.title: React Fetchable
gists.paragraph: Typed request handler for React that manages its own state.

gists.title: Sveltekit OAuth + Session Validation
gists.paragraph: OAuth and session management patterns for SvelteKit.

gists.title: Sveltekit  + Eth Wallet Connect
gists.paragraph: Add "Connect Ethereum Wallet" to a SvelteKit app.

gists.title: Upload Folder to Irys
gists.paragraph: Script for uploading a directory on-chain using Irys.

guides.title: Computer Setup
guides.paragraph: I've added a config pattern and CLI for detecting the current OS and syncing configs based on the environment.

guides.title: Docker
guides.paragraph: Docker at its core is a tool for organizing virtual machines. In this guide I go over how I use it for developing and hosting all my projects.

guides.title: Intro to Leptos
guides.paragraph: I am new to this framework and Rust so DYOR, what do I know. But, I've experimented with a lot of state shapes in web dev using meta frameworks like SvelteKit and lately the closest thing to what I've wanted is tRPC + Tanstack Query + tRPC/Tanstack Adapter.

guides.title: Obsidian Vault Syncing
guides.paragraph: I love [@obsdmd](https://x.com/obsdmd) and I just figured out a life changing addition to make my stack even better. I sync my vault to GitHub, but the problem with that is everything can only be 100% private or 100% public. I found a slick way around this so I can use one vault for everything.

guides.title: Svelte Cloudflare Worker
guides.paragraph: A super small Svelte app with a companion Cloudflare worker as a backend when you need it. It's kinda like Sveltekit, but more modular and less guided.

guides.title: Svelte Single File
guides.paragraph: Compile a Svelte project to a single index.html file.

guides.title: Sveltekit + Solana Wallet Signin
guides.paragraph: Full-stack SvelteKit example project showing "Sign in With Solana" patterns. - Use Solana wallet adapter & connect to wallet. - Request time-sensitive message from the backend. - Sign message using wallet. - Verify signature.

guides.title: Upload Files On-Chain Using Irys
guides.paragraph: In this guide, we will learn how to upload files on-chain using Solana, Irys, and TypeScript.

projects.title: XRAY Explorer
projects.paragraph: Human-readable Solana blockchain explorer built with SvelteKit. Built for Grizzlython hackathon.

projects.title: Calculate Merkle Tree Size CLI
projects.paragraph: Calculate Merkle Tree For example, run "npx cnfts calculate 8" to view tree configs that work with max proof 8.

projects.title: Compressed Bananas
projects.paragraph: A free cNFT dispenser in celebration of NYC Solana Hacker House and presented on demo day.

projects.title: Dedoc
projects.paragraph: Decentralized on-chain documentation suitable for any project. Content is stored for eternity on Arweave and verified on Solana using Metaplex cNFTs. Users are their own creators and own 100% of their data.

projects.title: Gibwallet CLI
projects.paragraph: Create a TipLink wallet on the fly by running `npx gibwallet`

projects.title: Jobs Board
projects.paragraph: Developed jobs board with AI candidate screening and external integrations.

projects.title: Matr Bot
projects.paragraph: A Discord bot developed for The 76 Devs community. The bot supports tracking the price of solana, verifying users, and distributing devnet SOL to those who request it by running `!gibsol`.

projects.title: On-Chain User Profiles
projects.paragraph: A user profiles protocol stored on Arweave, verified on Solana via compressed NFTs.

projects.title: OPOS Outliers
projects.paragraph: Mint a compressed NFT for free without a wallet using Solana and TipLink. Users are able to design an "OPOS Outlier" and mint it as a cNFT via Gmail-based claiming. The art and attributes were created by Web3 artists and brands.

projects.title: Sketchy Wallet
projects.paragraph: Generate a Solana wallet and email the credentials to someone. Perfect for those times when you need a one off wallet with keys auto backed up. I used this for making a wallet for my toddler so I can send him NFTs.

projects.title: Solana Terminal
projects.paragraph: Solana Terminal, an NFT explorer and utilities. Link your wallet and Discord, listen to music NFTs, render HTML NFTs, view your artwork, query NFTs by creator and more.

projects.title: State Machine Snacks
projects.paragraph: A framework built on [XState](https://xstate.js.org/docs/about/concepts.html) that provides bite sized snacks for developing with state machine machines. üçï aims to increase state machine adoption in modern day web apps by providing a suite of tools and plugins to inspire development and new ways of thinking.

projects.title: The 76 Devs
projects.paragraph: Created a Discord community where developers can ask questions and share what they're working on during our live show n tells. We have ~3k+ members in Discord and 1.5k+ on Twitter.

projects.title: User Profiles
projects.paragraph: Lead development of cross-app authentication and user profiles that supported 150k accounts.
